710793f.text:
Twelfth Avenue, south from W. 52nd Street, showing in a set of 2 views (also negatives) the widening of this thoroughfare preparatory to the extension of the West Side Elevated Highway. This, in conjunction with new 1000 foot piers will form one phase of the West Side Improvement. The piled debris seen in on the
easterly side of this thoroughfare.
June 30, 1930.
Views 1, 2, 3 and 4
F. L. Sperr

713632f.text:
632-636 West 52nd Street, south side, east of Twelfth avenue. No. 634 is a three-story and No. 636 is a two-story frame house. No. 632, on the left, is marked 630.
1932.
J. Clarenog.Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York,
Negative No. 212

732847f-b.title: Recreation and hobbies - Children playing.
732847f-b.text:
(1)
Recreations--children playing: New York youngsters take to rafting when other means of outdoor play are not available. This is a pond in a cut for new piers below De Witt Clinton Park, 12th Avenue and 52nd
Street, Manhattan.
P. L. Sperr 1933
NEG # 3970
(2)
Kids playing on a sand pile, Washington and Bank Streets, Manhattan.
P. L. Sperr 1933
(3)
A playground in Cherry Street, Manhatta, seen from the
Brooklyn Bridge.
P. L. Sperr 1933

710792f-b.text:
Twelfth Avenue, east side, between West 52nd and 54th Street's showing details of the widening of this thoroughfare at Dewitt Clinton Park. A slice of the latter was removed. View 1 is northeastward towards the buildings that frame the northerly edge of the Park. View 2 is southerlt towards the 52nd Street edge. The pavilion in the center of the park is not included.
May 21, 1936
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr
